author: wsjcom
title: New Jersey’s ‘Free’ College Plan Raises Many Concerns
text: Regarding you editorial “New Jersey’s Business Model” (April 7): Before raising taxes to fund free community-college tuition, New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy might want to consider how effective those community colleges are in actually educating students. All New Jersey community colleges offer an array of remedial classes for students who are ill-prepared to tackle college-level study. Based on statistics on its 19 community colleges published by the state of New Jersey, more than half of part-time students don’t graduate and 30% to 40% of full-time students don’t graduate. But bring on more taxes. My husband and I fled...
